We cannot allow this burden to fall on local business owners as they struggle to recover from the COVID-19 crisis. I will continue working across the aisle to ensure that the federal excise tax cuts that many Central Virginia distilleries depend on are made permanent. #VA07 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EfKU3GSWoAIsZHU.jpg

I'm a proud cosponsor of the Craft Beverage Modernization and Tax Reform Act, which would make the 2017 federal excise tax cut on distilled spirits permanent. Without this bill, craft distillers in Central Virginia would face a 400% tax hike in 2021. #VA07

On today's visit to Three Crosses Distilling, we also discussed the importance of maintaining federal excise tax levels (FET) for craft beverages and distilleries. Without FET, Three Crosses might be forced to stop using locally-grown corn from Goochland and Powhatan. #VA07 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EfKUZrHWkAAcAD6.jpg

Like many distilleries across the Commonwealth, Three Crosses Distilling began producing hand sanitizer early on in the pandemic. This innovative move helped them keep their doors open and met a critical need for Virginia hospitals, first responders, and local governments. #VA07

Today, I visited Three Crosses Distilling in Powhatan to learn about how this veteran-owned small business is innovating in the face of the COVID-19 crisis, and to listen to their concerns about relief efforts. I also met with leaders from @vaspirits & @DistilledSpirit. #VA07 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EfKUFyMWsAISaGD.jpg
